intro: Ornithopus scorpioides, commonly known as the scorpionweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in dense, spike-like clusters, and the leaves are linear and often hairy. Ornithopus scorpioides is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in regions with low rainfall.
